Reviews.Title: “Good IND choice”
Reviews.Author: WalkingBob
Reviews.Content: This is our hotel of choice at IND. All of the good points of the Hilton Hampton chain. Staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast was among the best I've had at a Hampton. Housekeeping is excellent and the bed comfortable. Everything in the room works as it should (except that I couldn't figure out the alarm clock--probably my shortcoming, not the clock. This is not a new problem for me, so I always take my own).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to Use Before Flying”
Reviews.Author: HunterLilly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one evening before heading out on an early morning flight. A very new and clean hotel. The shuttle to the airport was great! I was able to sign up for a time when we checked in and it was a quick drive to the front doors of the airport. We left our vehicle in the parking lot for the week. It was only $99! I was very pleased with that price! When we arrived back to the airport I called the hotel and the shuttle was there to pick us up in no time. Super easy! We will be using this Hampton Inn again. The only restaurant nearby is a Subway. Be sure to eat before arriving if you're not interested in driving to find a place to eat.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: exteacher60
Reviews.Content: Great value. We used their stay and fly option. Paid $163 for the overnight stay and leaving the car for the week. Drop off at and pick-up from the airport went flawlessly. We left too early to take advantage of the free breakfast, though Hampton's are usually very good. The room was very well appointed and large.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at Indy Hampton”
Reviews.Author: Devilgirl08
Reviews.Content: We were in town for 3 nights for the Jamfest Super Nationals Cheerleading Competition. We stayed here because of the high costs at downtown Indy hotels. The stay was good. Breakfast was ample and the variety was good for our cheerleaders. The pool was clean but way too chlorinated. As soon as you walked in the pool area wham, chlorine over load. Our room was very clean. In between housekeeping was awesome, good job, thanks for that. However, my only negative comment would be at the check in, I asked for a room away from the elevator. My room was in the elevator by the sound of it. The back of the elevator was on the wall of our room. We constantly heard the elevator door open and close. It was weird sound. I would suggest to the hotel not to use the rooms that are close to the elevator as you will be moving people. We knew the hotel was sold out so we didn't bother to ask to be moved. But come on, we check in before others did and speifically asked to be away from the elevator. Bad job on that one front desk clerk.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay before early morning flight”
Reviews.Author: susie6505
Reviews.Content: We were heading out for our Christmas Vacation and stayed here. They offer the Park-n-Fly option, which was fantastic! We were gone 15 days total, and parking at the hotel was excellent! The shuttle from the hotel to the airport was great. There is a Hilton next door that the shuttle stops at on the way to the airport. We were able to get breakfast, which was nice especially since we were flying all day. When we returned, we called the front desk and with a short walk out of the airport, our shuttle was already there! The staff at check-in were really helpful re: where to park are vehicle. I HIGHLY recommend the Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “NO SLEEP POSSIBLE; EVERYTHING ELSE GREAT”
Reviews.Author: Picky2009
Reviews.Content: Good news: The hotel itself was wonderful, as were the personnel. It was well kept, smoke free, and almost perfect. The bad news (and it was horrible): I only got to sleep two hours due to the fact that this hotel is located on the direct approach of Fed Ex airplanes. We arrived around 11 pm, but after midnight, especially at 2:37 am, we were kept awake by low flying planes owned by Fed Ex and landing at their own airport every 15 minutes. We did a park and fly, so they only value we got out this stay was the parking. However, this sleep deprivation impacted the entire following day of our vacation. Someone screwed up somewhere and built this hotel on a direct approach to a private airport. I have stayed at hotels near airports, but never at one like this. We stayed on December 23rd, so do not know if the holidays resulted in a huge increase in air traffic for Fed Ex. Perhaps if we stayed on the first floor of this 3 story hotel it may not have been bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Park N Fly experience”
Reviews.Author: ILnaturetrav
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before flying out of Indy airport. This is a new Hampton and it is very clean. We were traveling with our adult children and we were very happy to get a large room with a roll away bed. It was one of the best experiences as there was plenty of space to move around. We had a 6:00am shuttle to the airport and were able to get a quick bite of breakfast as they were just opening up as we came down to the lobby. The shuttle worked well both ways and we felt safe leaving our van because of the well lit parking lot. We are Hilton Honors members and usually stay at Homewood Suites and Hampton Inns. This one was one of the best we have stayed in. As to the 4:00AM plane noise...yes it did start up about that time. Two of us are light sleepers and two are not. We light sleepers were awaken by the noise, but it did not keep me awake. It is nice to be near the airport for park n fly, even with the noise factor.

Reviews.Title: “One Night asnd GREAT Stay!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MDHKLR04
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night to catch an early morning flight, the hotel was fantastic! Much more than I would expect from a Hampton Inn, very new and open concept lobby. Clean, clean, clean, and very well appointed rooms as well. Just a short 5-7 minutes from the airport and plenty of parking. The staff is very warm and welcoming, I would never hesitate staying here again. I give this one of my best ratings as it far exceeds what you expect from a Hampton Inn. Well done and thanks!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, BUT...ridiculous noise”
Reviews.Author: Stras88
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I love Hampton Inns and stay at them regularly and this hotel ranks right up there in terms of cleanliness and service, BUT I couldn't believe that I was shaken out of bed at 4:00 a.m.(!) to the rush of airplanes buzzing the hotel every 3-5 minutes. I'm used to staying at hotels near airports, so I expected some level of noise--it usually doesn't bother me as I'm anything but a light sleeper--but this place is ridiculously close to the Indianapolis Airport and the jet sounds are LOUD and start in the middle of the night! To say I was disappointed, is a bit of an understatement. I really would have appreciated to have known this before I booked my reservation as I most certainly would have avoided this particular Hampton Inn. Traveler beware!

Reviews.Title: “Roomy and surprisingly quiet”
Reviews.Author: JsCcB
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel very late after finding two Hampton Inns on the east side of town full. The reception clerk gave us an upgraded room -- a beautiful suite. We were pleased that the room was nearly sound proof: we heard two service planes which must have been close, and then complete silence. Even in the busy morning hours, the room was silent. I would go back to this hotel anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: loverofcats22
Reviews.Content: This is newer hotel (3 years) very near the airport. Currently it's in the middle of an empty field except for another hotel. Had no problems finding it with the GPS. Interior foyer and breakfast area were very impressive. Room was very comfortable and modern. Only negatives were that there was no exhaust fan in the bathroom and we heard a compressor noise about every 30 minutes that would only last for about 5 minutes. Not sure what that was...we were two doors down from the enclosed Convenience Room. This room is located next to the elevator and contains 2 each washers/dryers, drink machine and ice machine. Not sure if we were hearing a machine from this room or not, but it was somewhat anoying. If you were a light sleeper, it would have been a problem. Otherwise, the room seemed to be well insultated against noise...didn't hear traffic in the hall or nearby rooms. Nice interior decorations in room and flatscreen TV, Workers at front desk were always friendly and helpful. Didn't use it but there was a shuttle for airport transportation. Breakfast area was very modern and spacious. Food was excellent and service was friendly. We viewed the pool and workout room which both seemed very nice, but didn't have time to use. Hotel has two elevators that were prompt. Nice business center with computers we used to print boarding passes. As for nearby restaurants, we were told that the hotel next door did have a restuarant/bar. We chose to explore and traveled about 10 minutes and found many nice choices to eat at. Very nice hotel which we would recommend and plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, new and clean . . . but nothing nearby”
Reviews.Author: jondf
Reviews.Content: As written elsewhere this hotel is quite new and aside from an equally new HGI adjacent there is nothing at all here. No fuel (vehicle or human), no coffee shops, no quick mart. NOTHING. Literally 2 minutes from the airport, it doesn't get easier than this. Nice room - shandard Hampton but very clean and everything worked. Front desk staff couldn't have been nicer. Breakfast was better than usual for Hampton. I'd probably stay one exit back and across I70 at the the Hampton Plainview next time only so I wouldn't have to scout so far for food and gas but if being really close to the airport is a major consideration you can't do better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Friendly and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: LucindaR_11
Reviews.Content: I arrived late at Indianapolis Airport and checked into the Hampton near the airport. As a frequent traveler, I wasn't expecting much from an airport hotel. This Hampton Inn & Suites was a very pleasant surprise. The front desk agent was very warm and welcoming, the lobby was very well maintained and the decor was very nice. the King room was large comfortable and had all the amenities I needed for work and rest. The airport is very close to downtown, so I was able to make my appointment easily the next morning. I am very happy I decided to stay near the airport at the Hampton.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, comfortable hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: jskains
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times over the past year for business and I am always pleased. The hotel is very clean, the staff people are extremely accommodating and always eager to help. There is a nice workout facility with free weights, treadmills, and an elliptical machine. There is also an indoor pool and hot tub. The only down side to the hotel is its location. It is convenient to the Indianapolis airport, but there are not very many restaurant choices close by. The area is in growth mode though and dining options seem to pop up all the time. All in all, this is hotel is a great value and well worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “IT WAS AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: CJANDFRED
Reviews.Content: The property well beautiful and well maintained. The staff was very professional and courteous. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “best airport hotel with everything you need”
Reviews.Author: Lesdeak
Reviews.Content: if you have one night layover for the indianapolis airport this is the place to stay. Hotel sparkels with newness and staff are outstanding. everything you need is here including beautiful pool, comfortable beds, all day coffee, quiet, and a staff that wants to do whatever they can to make you happy. the free breakfast is also great and if you want full service go a few steps to their sister property the hilton garden inn for good restaurant food. i ate dinner there and was pleased. i call this my little resort hotel because that's how i felt for one night between flights back east.

Reviews.Title: “Close & convenient to airport,”
Reviews.Author: fivesheds
Reviews.Content: Quite a new modern hotel & close to airport with good shuttle service. Staff were helpfull Room was spacious , clean. Close to airport & you can get room noise from planes taking off, even through the night hours, I had a room at the back of the hotel, not sure if rooms at the front are quieter

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Indyhost
Reviews.Content: This is a great airport hotel first and formost they have free 24 hours shuttle service to the airport! Plus Hamtpons are just awesome great beds and free breakfast along with internet! To the guy who said in a previous review that there was any restaurants in walking distance there is a Hilton Garden Inn across the parking lot that has a restuarant and A HUGE empty commerical piece of land in bewteen them I am sure a restaurant is coming soon. I had jimmy johns deliever to my room so it wasnt a big deal. Anwyays if you need a hotel close the airport this is your hotel! OH I NEVER HEARD ONE THING FROM FED X!

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Indy”
Reviews.Author: dantillweed
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel located directly on the flight path, so unless you like to awaken at 4.15 am to the sound of Fed Ex jets that go right over the hotel skip this one! Also, there are no resturants for 2.5 miles either.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: RangerMach1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hampton in for 5 nights while on a business trip while in Indianapolis. The staff was excellent. Very friendly and greeted you every time you walked in the front door. Very quick to help out if you had any questions or problems. Rooms are very clean and extremely comfortable. Would very highly recommend this hotel. Im going to be in Indianapolis again in the near future on business, and I plan on requesting this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for more”
Reviews.Author: bonba52
Reviews.Content: We had a family wedding. The hotel was selected for us. Reading reviews I thought Oh Boy! But honestly it was great. Yes there is an airport but it did not bother us. EVERTHING was exceptional. The beds were the most comfortable I have ever slept on in a motel. I am a bad sleeper so that is saying something. The only problem we had was commication with the cleaning staff. Not very good english. Happens most places these days. Would never thought to much about it but we lost a a member of our family, the housekeeper did not have clue what I was saying.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience at the Hampton Inn near the Indianapolis Airport”
Reviews.Author: rmkc
Reviews.Content: We had several members of our extended family stay at this hotel for the weekend for a family reunion in Indianapolis. I was impressed at the cleanliness of the hotel. Our room and all of the commons areas we enjoyed were spotless clean. The location of the hotel is very close to the airport, although the hotel kind of sits of by itself in a newly developed area. The closest shopping and dining is about 15-20 minutes away, with the exception of a restaurant at the Hilton Garden Inn right next door. The rooms were nice, although a little small for a double room. The beds are very comfortable, and suprisingly I did not hear a lot of noise being so close to the airport. The free breakfast buffet is very good, and we really enjoyed the complimentary coffee throughout the day. The only real complaint I had was with the service of the front desk staff. I had issues with making my reservation over the phone, had to call several times to get my email confirmation, had poor service and check-in with a man who was less than thrilled to be answering our questions, and worst of all was my check out experience. I was waiting in line behind another man checking out and was completely ignored by the older lady working behind the front desk. When another couple came up to the desk she greeted them, and then after helping the man in front of me, walked over to the other side of the counter to help the couple who had came in after me, completely ignoring me all together! When I mentioned very nicely that I had been waiting, the other couple (not the staff!) told me to go ahead and the staff member never even apologized! I expected better service at a Hampton! But, overall I did enjoy my stay at this nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your ear protection-"Close to airport" really means - "End of runway!"”
Reviews.Author: UXU
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy watching and listening to jet aircraft at all hours of the day, then this is the place for you. This location is pretty much directly in-line with the main runways of Indy International - and the land must have been pretty cheap here, as there are no other buildings out on Hatfield Drive, besides a nearby Hilton. Everything else is pretty great though - good breakfast from 6-10AM, a nice indoor pool and small, but adequate exercise center with 3 treadmills, some free weights and a couple of stationary bikes. Also - if you are looking for "High Speed Internet", then this isn't the place either. I hit a few internet speed test sites and the best I got was 70k down/12k up - so VPN and remote desktop sessions are out of the question. Want to watch a YouTube video - ain't gonna happen. Skype? Nope - to slow. If you decide to stay here - make sure to have a car. If you don't - you will be bored out of your skull - unless you like the roar of incoming and outgoing jet aircraft.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: CYtravels
Reviews.Content: I had to stay at this hotel because I was stranded in Indianapolis due to bad weather, the airline paid for my stay here. I was pleasantly surprised how CLEAN this hotel was. I usually thought airport hotels were dingy low-star hotels but I was wrong about this one. The staff was very nice, friendly, and helpful. The room was CLEAN. The bed was more comfortable than the bed I slept on in a 4-star hotel when I actually arrived at my real destination. Even the hallways were clean-looking. This is a good basic hotel to stay at if you only need a place to sleep for the night. Thanks Eric the AGM, he's a pretty good-looking guy!

Reviews.Title: “Never Ever Stay Here Unless You are Deaf”
Reviews.Author: Benzimidazolone
Reviews.Content: About 6 months I stayed at this Hampton near the Indianapolis Airport and somehow, I forgot the experience and stupidly stayed there again this week. I am a regular business traveler and stay log about 75 hotel nights a year. The 'experience' happened at about 4am. I woke up from a deep sleep in a terror that I was in the middle of a tornado or hurricane....but it was just the UPS cargo jets taking off. The noise was very loud, the room shook and the windows rattled. Maybe it would have been better on the 1st floor (I was on the 4th/top) but I doubt it. It was as if I was sleeping on the runway. Later when I looked at a map I realized that I was sleeping on the runway!! The hotel (and the sister hotel, the Hilton Garden Inn right beside it) is at the end of the runway. There is a very good reason that these are the only two hotels in this location. The rest of the 'airport' hotels are on the other side, away from the worst of landing and taking off noise. There is all sorts of vacant land around the area with 'for sale' signs proclaiming the spot is great for a hotel....these guys are probably trying to sell some 'beautiful' Florida swampland for beach condos as well too.Hamptons are usually great spots. The staff here is typically Hampton. They are very courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Close to the Airport”
Reviews.Author: Bug_Doctor
Reviews.Content: This is one of the closest hotels to the airport. Although it does seem isolated, there are many restaurants and stores close by if you don't want to drive to Indianapolis. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is very elegant and the rooms are very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “clean and quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelingmom1955
Reviews.Content: stayed in hampton inn for final four weekend - found it to be a very clean hotel rooms extremely quiet staff friendly breakfast good can't think of anything to say negative about the stay

Reviews.Title: “Brand New Place--within sight of the airport”
Reviews.Author: Eyegore
Reviews.Content: I was booked here by the Executive Assistant for the boss in order to attend a week-long training session. This hotel is the chosen one for the agency I was training at. Upon arrival, the desk staff quickly and efficiently got my checked in. They were very friendly. The lobby was clean and looked very professional and classy. My room was enormous. I had to be put into a different room than originally booked due to a mix-up in the reservations area of the hotel. The cleaning staff did a great job every day. The morning breakfast buffet was basic, but tasty. The lady running the thing was open to suggestions (wet naps available when pancakes/french toast/syrup served) and kept the place stocked. The pool area was clean, as was the small workout room. The desk staff were incredibly knowledgable about local eateries and the easiest way to get to them. The only negative, I guess, was being awakened at 0545 every morning by the early morning rush of planes leaving the airport that took off right over the hotel. Not a bad little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New Hampton Inn near new Indy Airport”
Reviews.Author: azogal
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new Hampton Inn that is just a few minutes from the new Indy airport. It is clean and quiet and well run. We stayed here the night before an early flight and again at the end of the same trip because of a late arrival and a snow storm. Both times the breakfast area was well stocked and the rooms were quiet and clean. The rooms were $99/night. This and the new Hilton Garden Inn are in an empty field so there are no restaurants or other entertainment nearby. More businesses are sure to pop up as development occurs around the new airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: Edger66
Reviews.Content: Great Hampton with a good location. Brand new building close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Close to Indianapolis Airport”
Reviews.Author: ncypeacock
Reviews.Content: Was on a business trip that was 45 minutes from airport. Had an early flight so I used this hotel. It is a brand new Hampton Inn and Hilton that is really close to the airport. They have free shuttle to and from the airport. It is in a large field and there are no other buildings around. The Hilton has a restaurant. The pool and whirpool were great. If you have an early flight this is the best place to stay. As I was catching the 4 am shuttle, the shuttle was bringing in 5 people who have traveled from overseas.

Reviews.Title: “Free laundry room. No nearby restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: calgal55
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, new Hampton Inn built near the new Indianapolis Airport. The location is good for close proximity to the airport - but there are no restaurants (except for 1 at the adjacent Hilton Garden Inn) that are close and easy to get too. The rooms are fine - a little cramped with 2 queen beds. We missed having the microwave and mini-refrigerator that we usually get at Hampton Inns. But we loved the free laundry room - very nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the rooms”
Reviews.Author: arpanKolkata
Reviews.Content: It was a great experience and loved the simplicity of the hotel. The bathrooms are well equipped and clean. Good heating system installed in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for access to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Drew2
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other reviews on this property. This hotel is great. I stayed here twice in 4 days on my way in and out of town on the Indy 500 weekend. I arrived late at the airport and called for the shuttle. It didn't take more than 10 minutes for them to arrive. Everything is so new. They gave me a suite on the 4th floor at the very end of the hall. It had a kitchenette and a huge living room and a desk dividing the room. Breakfast was standard for a Hampton. The gym is the best I have ever seen in a Hampton Inn or most other hotels. Before my flight out of town the next day, I stayed here. I was given a typical room with a shower only, no tub. It was really nice and served its purpose. There is absolutely nothing around this place so you would need a car, but for an airport location it is great. I would definitely choose to stay here again if I have a similar travel schedule as I did with this trip.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: julzbeth29
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hampton Inn near the Indianapolis airport several months ago. I rarely leave reviews for places, but I was so pleased with my stay..they deserved some credit! It is a new hotel and the hotel facilities are clean, with a nice pool area and workout room. The room was also spacious and clean. We stayed in a room with a King Bed. When we got to our room..it didn't have that "typical hotel room" feel to it. It actually was arranged more like a room in my own house! The bathroom was large with a large step in shower. The lights were energy savers and came on automatically. I try to stay in Hampton Inn's whenever I travel because you are usually guarenteed a nice stay. I must say that this is the nicest hotel I've been in for awhile...even nicer than the Hilton's and Marriot's we occasionally stay in when travelling to larger cities. The price of this hotel was $100 cheaper than the older Hampton Inn 10 minutes down the highway. If I had to say a down fall...this hotel is in an area that is not developed yet and there are not much for dining and entertainment in the immediate area.

HotelInfo.Name: Hampton Inn & Suites Indianapolis-Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 9020 Hatfield Drive, Indianapolis, IN 46231
